body.p: Which of the following has a point estimate of 4.2?

multiple_choice.choice: The percentage of all college students who exercise on a regular basis
The mean time that all college students spend exercising per week
The mean time that all college students who exercise on a regular basis spend exercising per week

response.feedback: Incorrect. The value 4.2 is an averageâ€”a mean calculated from the sample and therefore is a point estimate for the population mean and not population percentage or proportion.
Incorrect. The value 4.2 is not calculated using data from the entire sample of college students (2,540) but rather from the subset of those students who exercise on a regular basis.

Correct. The value 4.2 was calculated using data only from the 1,742 students who exercise on a regular basis, and therefore, it is the point estimate for the mean number of exercise hours per week in the population of college students who exercise on a regular basis.

part.hint: Was the average of 4.2 hours of exercise per week calculated using data from all 2,540 students or only from the 1,742 students who exercise on a regular basis?
